Name: toluene diisocyanate production | hydrochloric acid, without water, in 30% solution state | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2013:Manufacture of plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms
Description: This inventory represents the average production of toluene diisocyanate, provided as a generic dataset in which TDI production covers both (1) toluene and (2) dinitrotoluene as raw materials.;In more detail, the chemical processes involved in the TDI production are described below.;First, toluene, as the primary raw material for the industrial manufacturing of TDI, undergoes catalytic nitration, yielding approximately an 80:20 mixture of 2,4- and 2,6-dinitrotoluene (DNT) isomers. Hence, plants may start the production of TDI with either toluene or the respective mixture of DNT isomers. ;Nitration of toluene: C6H5CH3 + 2 HNO3 --> C7H6N2O4 + 2 H2O;A hydrogenation step follows, where the DNT mixture is converted to diaminotoluene (TDA) isomers.;Hydrogenation of dinitrotoluene: C7H6N2O4 + 6 H2 --> C7H10N2 + 4 H2O;;The corresponding TDA mixture is subsequently treated with phosgene to produce a TDI isomer mixture in solution, along with HCl byproduct.;Toluene diamine phosgenation: C7H10N2 + 2 COCl2 --> C9H6N2O2 + 4 HCl;In absence of phosgene in the form of a raw material, this intermediate is produced on-side from carbon monoxide and chlorine.;Phosgene production: CO + Cl2 -->  COCl2;The solution is then purified via distillation, in which the 80:20 TDI isomer composition is maintained. Finally, a fractionation step is carried out, which yields a stream with 100% 2,4-TDI and another stream with a 65:35 mixture of 2,4- and 2,6-TDI isomers.;References:;2021, ISOPA , Eco-profile of toluene diisocyanate (TDI) and methylene diphenyl diisocyanate (MDI) , 3 - SeparatePublication
